jcr:content.jcr:title: Coat of arms of the Cayman Islands

contentheadline.headline: Coat of arms of the Cayman Islands

contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} [[File:Coat of arms of the Cayman Islands.svg|right|200px]] The '''[[Cayman Islands]]’ coat of arms''' consists of a shield, a crested helm and the motto. Three green stars, representing each of the three inhabited Islands ([[Grand Cayman]], [[Little Cayman]] and [[Cayman Brac]]), are set in the lower two-thirds of the shield. The stars rest on blue and white wavy bands representing the sea. In the top third of the shield, against a red background, is a gold [[lion]] ''passant guardant'' (walking with the further forepaw raised and the body seen from the side), representing [[United Kingdom|Britain]]. Above the shield is a [[Green sea turtle|green turtle]] on a coil of [[rope]]. Behind the turtle is a gold [[pineapple]]. The turtle represents the Caymans’ seafaring history; the rope, its traditional thatch-rope industry; and the pineapple, its ties with [[Jamaica]]. The islands’ motto, “He hath founded it upon the seas”, is printed at the bottom of the shield. This line, a verse from [[Psalms|Psalm]] 24, acknowledges the Caymans’ [[Christian]] heritage, as well as its ties to the sea. The proposal for a coat of arms was approved by the Legislative Assembly in 1957, and public input was sought on its design. The Royal Warrant assigning “Armorial Ensigns for the Cayman Islands” was approved by [[Elizabeth II|Her Majesty]]’s command on 14 May 1958. ==See also== * [[List of coats of arms of the United Kingdom and dependencies]] {{British coat of arms}} {{Coat of arms of North America}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Coat Of Arms Of The Cayman Islands}} [[Category:British Overseas Territories coats of arms|Cayman Islands]] [[Category:National coats of arms|Cayman Islands]] [[Category:Caymanian culture]] [[Category:1958 introductions]]
